text: Tom enters and shakes hands politely.
Good morning. Nice to meet you. Please, have a seat.
Good morning. Nice to meet you too.
Manager looks at Tom’s CV.
So, Tom, why would you like to work here?
I like working with people, and I enjoy being in a busy environment. I also come to this café often.
The manager smiles.
That’s nice to hear. Do you have any work experience?
Yes, I worked part-time in another café last summer. I served customers and helped in the kitchen.
Manager writes notes.
Yes, I’m a university student. I study business management.
The manager nods.
When are you available to work?
I can work at the weekends and two afternoons during the week.
Manager smiles approvingly.
That’s perfect. We often need help on Saturdays. Do you mind working early in the morning?
No, not at all. I’m used to waking up early.
Manager stands up and shakes Tom’s hand.
Excellent, Tom. Thank you for coming today. We’ll get back in touch with you in a few days.
Thank you very much. Have a nice day.
